Preprocessing Helpers

Source: vignettes/tutorial/helpers.Rmd
helpers.Rmd

Add Date Information

We included some handy timestamp converters which enrich datasets with useful information. Let’s demonstrate it with a simple example:

library(fxtract)
df = data.frame(timestamp = c(946733820, 946733821, 946733822), x = "some_data")
#corresponds to 2000-01-01 13:37, 2000-01-01 13:37:01, 2000-01-01 13:37:02
df
##   timestamp         x
## 1 946733820 some_data
## 2 946733821 some_data
## 3 946733822 some_data

add_date_time

This function adds a date_time variable from the lubridate package to your dataset:

add_date_time(data = df, utc_col = "timestamp")
##   timestamp         x           date_time
## 1 946733820 some_data 2000-01-01 13:37:00
## 2 946733821 some_data 2000-01-01 13:37:01
## 3 946733822 some_data 2000-01-01 13:37:02

add_date

This function adds a date variable from the lubridate package to your dataset:

add_date(data = df, utc_col = "timestamp")
##   timestamp         x       date
## 1 946733820 some_data 2000-01-01
## 2 946733821 some_data 2000-01-01
## 3 946733822 some_data 2000-01-01

add_weekday

This funciton adds an ordered weekday variable from the lubridate package to your dataset:

add_weekday(data = df, utc_col = "timestamp")
##   timestamp         x weekday
## 1 946733820 some_data     Sat
## 2 946733821 some_data     Sat
## 3 946733822 some_data     Sat

add_time

This funciton adds a time variable lubridate package to your dataset:

add_time(data = df, utc_col = "timestamp")
##   timestamp         x     time
## 1 946733820 some_data 13:37:00
## 2 946733821 some_data 13:37:01
## 3 946733822 some_data 13:37:02
